Text:
@PiratePatch
tried running it as admin?it works fine at my side here.
Installed it, moved patch to directory and ran it: still wants code to start. This thing work?
Same issue here as Gorgang.  Installed it, copied the file, ran it...still asks for registration when you open it.
have u guys click "patch"?not just run the patch alone,u need to make sure the patching work is done.

'have u guys click "patch"?not just run the patch alone' is confusing. Again, the patch was transferred to the installed magix directory, run until a kind of green "ok" showed; but, when the program ran after this patching, it still asks for registration code. 

Note: the tiny patch image is rather tricky to see and read and use. I appreciate the effort to make this work, but some user-friendly tweaking is needed.

Same issue as gorgang and shaker8. Clicked the patch icon/text and retried the launch but it still asks for the license. I am running on XP with no user names/admin set up and any help will be greatly appreciated K-Kid. Thanks in advance :)
hmm thats weird. i'll try come up with a fix for it soon. probably the patch doesn't works with xp. idk.
Norton 360 said there is a Gehenna.exe/Trojan_gen_2 in the patch file
i dont have any more space in C/ so i have all off it in D/ but every file is in D/ so i made an map and put everything in that map where to put patch?
